question:
A jar contains 7 red balls and 9 blue balls. We choose, uniformly at random and without replacement, 3 balls. Define the following two events: [defs] A = "exactly 2 of the balls are red" B = "the number of red balls is even" [/defs] What is the conditional probability $\Pr(A|B)$? (Recall that 0 is even.)
$\frac{{9 \choose 3} + 9 \cdot {7 \choose 2}}{9 \cdot {7 \choose 2}}$ $\frac{9 \cdot {7 \choose 2}}{{16 \choose 3}}$ $\frac{{9 \choose 3} + 9 \cdot {7 \choose 2}}{{16 \choose 3}}$ $\frac{9 \cdot {7 \choose 2}}{{9 \choose 3} + 9 \cdot {7 \choose 2}}$
